title: What's the equation after replacing $$x$$ with $$y$$ and $$y$$ with $$x$$
Solve for $$y$$
text: We can rise both sides to the fifth power then add $$2$$ both sides. It gives $$x^5+2=3y$$. We can isolate $$y$$ on one sides by dividing $$3$$ both sides which gives $$y$$ =(x**5 +2)/3. We can further simplify it into $$y$$ $$=\frac{1}{3} x^5+\frac{2}{3}$$ which is the final answer.
